<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29188).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29188#issuecomment-1878933847), [dongcarl](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29188#issuecomment-1879020304) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)
* [#25391](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25391) (guix: Use LTO to build releases by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (build: LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> which should also fix the RISC-V macOS cross build

I think that is currently failing due to a bug in the llvm upstream build system (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28880#issuecomment-1846869958)

Other than that:

Nice!

> I think that is currently failing due to a bug in the llvm upstream build system (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28880#issuecomment-1846869958)

Right, I was referring to this failure, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29078#issuecomment-1863598765, where we can't compile cctools on RISC-V, because it just isn't supported.
Expecting that macOS cross-compiling CI job will fail and we need to reapply https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/05aca093819be276ac7d648472c6ed5c7d235cc5.
